intro: Pycreus flavescens var. rehmannianus, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of desert ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
